book.description: 05-DEU-asv.sfm The American Standard Version of the Holy Bible (1901) Tuesday, September 12, 2006

toc1: The Fifth Book of Moses, called Deuteronomy

mt1: The Fifth Book of Moses, called Deuteronomy

contents.verseText: These are the words which Moses spake unto all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah over against Suph, between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Di-zahab.
contents: These are the words which Moses spake unto all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah over against
Suph, between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Di-zahab.

contents.verseText: It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of mount Seir unto Kadesh-barnea.
contents: It is eleven days’
from Horeb by the way of mount Seir unto Kadesh-barnea.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spake unto the children of Israel, according unto all that Jehovah had given him in commandment unto them;
contents: And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spake unto the
children of Israel, according unto all that Jehovah had given him in commandment unto them;

contents.verseText: after he had smitten Sihon the king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who dwelt in Ashtaroth, at Edrei.
contents: after he had smitten Sihon the king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who dwelt in
Ashtaroth, at Edrei.

contents.verseText: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,
contents: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,

contents.verseText: Jehovah our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mountain:
contents: Jehovah our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mountain:

contents.verseText: turn you, and take your journey, and go to the hill-country of the Amorites, and unto all the places nigh thereunto, in the Arabah, in the hill-country, and in the lowland, and in the South, and by the sea-shore, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.
contents: turn you, and take your journey, and go to the hill-country of the Amorites, and unto all

nigh thereunto, in the Arabah, in the hill-country, and in the lowland, and in the South, and by the sea-shore, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.

contents.verseText: Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which Jehovah sware unto your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.
contents: Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which Jehovah sware unto your fathers, to Abraham, to
Isaac, and to Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.

contents.verseText: And I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:
contents: And I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:

contents.verseText: Jehovah your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.
contents: Jehovah your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.

contents.verseText: Jehovah, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times as many as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you!
contents: Jehovah, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times as many as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you!

contents.verseText: How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
contents: How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?

contents.verseText: Take you wise men, and understanding, and known, according to your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.
contents: Take you wise men, and understanding, and known, according to your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.

contents.verseText: And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good for us to do.
contents: And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good
to do.

contents.verseText: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds, and captains of fifties, and captains of tens, and officers, according to your tribes.
contents: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains of thousands, and
captains of hundreds, and captains of fifties, and captains of tens, and officers, according to your tribes.

contents.verseText: And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear the causes between your brethren, and judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the sojourner that is with him.
contents: And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear
between your brethren, and judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the sojourner that is with him.

contents.verseText: Ye shall not respect persons in judgment; ye shall hear the small and the great alike; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man; for the judgment is God’s: and the cause that is too hard for you ye shall bring unto me, and I will hear it.
contents: Ye shall not respect persons in judgment; ye shall hear the small and the great alike; ye shall not be afraid of the face
of man; for the judgment is God’s: and the cause that is too hard for you ye shall bring unto me, and I will hear it.

contents.verseText: And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.
contents: And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.

contents.verseText: And we journeyed from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wilderness which ye saw, by the way to the hill-country of the Amorites, as Jehovah our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh-barnea.
contents: And we journeyed from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wilderness which ye saw, by the way to the
hill-country of the Amorites, as Jehovah our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh-barnea.

contents.verseText: And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the hill-country of the Amorites, which Jehovah our God giveth unto us.
contents: And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the hill-country of the Amorites, which Jehovah our God giveth unto us.

contents.verseText: Behold, Jehovah thy God hath set the land before thee: go up, take possession, as Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, hath spoken unto thee; fear not, neither be dismayed.
contents: Behold, Jehovah thy God hath set the land before thee: go up, take possession, as Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, hath
spoken unto thee; fear not, neither be dismayed.

contents.verseText: And ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, Let us send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and bring us word again of the way by which we must go up, and the cities unto which we shall come.
contents: And ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, Let us send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and
bring us word again of the way by which we must go up, and the cities unto which we shall come.

contents.verseText: And the thing pleased me well; and I took twelve men of you, one man for every tribe:
contents: And the thing pleased me well; and I took twelve men of you, one man for every tribe:

contents.verseText: and they turned and went up into the hill-country, and came unto the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.
contents: and they turned and went up into the hill-country, and came unto the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.

contents.verseText: And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, It is a good land which Jehovah our God giveth unto us.
contents: And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down unto us, and brought us word again, and said,
It is a good land which Jehovah our God giveth unto us.

contents.verseText: Yet ye would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of Jehovah your God:
contents: Yet ye would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of Jehovah your God:

contents.verseText: and ye murmured in your tents, and said, Because Jehovah hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.
contents: and ye murmured in your tents, and said, Because Jehovah hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, to
deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.

contents.verseText: Whither are we going up? our brethren have made our heart to melt, saying, The people are greater and taller than we; the cities are great and fortified up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakim there.
contents: Whither are we going up? our brethren have made our heart to melt, saying, The people are greater and taller than we; the
cities are great and fortified up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakim there.

contents.verseText: Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.
contents: Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.

contents.verseText: Jehovah your God who goeth before you, he will fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
contents: Jehovah your God who goeth before you, he will fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your
eyes,

contents.verseText: and in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that Jehovah thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way that ye went, until ye came unto this place.
contents: and in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that Jehovah thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the
way that ye went, until ye came unto this place.

contents.verseText: Yet in this thing ye did not believe Jehovah your God,
contents: Yet in this thing ye did not believe Jehovah your God,

contents.verseText: who went before you in the way, to seek you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, to show you by what way ye should go, and in the cloud by day.
contents: who went before you in the way, to seek you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, to show you by what way
ye should go, and in the cloud by day.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,
contents: And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,

contents.verseText: Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see the good land, which I sware to give unto your fathers,
contents: Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see the good land, which I sware to give unto your
fathers,

contents.verseText: save Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it; and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath wholly followed Jehovah.
contents: save Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it; and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his
children, because he hath wholly followed Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Also Jehovah was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not go in thither:
contents: Also Jehovah was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not go in thither:

contents.verseText: Joshua the son of Nun, who standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: encourage thou him; for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
contents: Joshua the son of Nun, who standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: encourage thou him; for he shall cause Israel to
inherit it.

contents.verseText: Moreover your little ones, that ye said should be a prey, and your children, that this day have no knowledge of good or evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
contents: Moreover your little ones, that ye said should be a prey, and your children, that this day have no knowledge of good or
evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.

contents.verseText: But as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.
contents: But as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.

contents.verseText: Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against Jehovah, we will go up and fight, according to all that Jehovah our God commanded us. And ye girded on every man his weapons of war, and were forward to go up into the hill-country.
contents: Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against Jehovah, we will go up and fight, according to all that Jehovah
our God commanded us. And ye girded on every man his weapons of war, and were forward to go up into the hill-country.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight; for I am not among you; lest ye be smitten before your enemies.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight; for I am not among you; lest ye be smitten before your
enemies.

contents.verseText: So I spake unto you, and ye hearkened not; but ye rebelled against the commandment of Jehovah, and were presumptuous, and went up into the hill-country.
contents: So I spake unto you, and ye hearkened not; but ye rebelled against the commandment of Jehovah, and were presumptuous, and
went up into the hill-country.

contents.verseText: And the Amorites, that dwelt in that hill-country, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and beat you down in Seir, even unto Hormah.
contents: And the Amorites, that dwelt in that hill-country, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and beat you down in
Seir, even unto Hormah.

contents.verseText: And ye returned and wept before Jehovah; but Jehovah hearkened not to your voice, nor gave ear unto you.
contents: And ye returned and wept before Jehovah; but Jehovah hearkened not to your voice, nor gave ear unto you.

contents.verseText: So ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye abode there.
contents: So ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye abode

contents.verseText: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea, as Jehovah spake unto me; and we compassed mount Seir many days.
contents: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea, as Jehovah spake unto me; and we
compassed mount Seir many days.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah spake unto me, saying,
contents: And Jehovah spake unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.
contents: Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.

contents.verseText: And command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the border of your brethren the children of Esau, that dwell in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. Take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore;
contents: And command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the border of your brethren the children of Esau, that dwell
in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. Take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore;

contents.verseText: contend not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on; because I have given mount Seir unto Esau for a possession.
contents: contend not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on;
because I have given mount Seir unto Esau for a possession.

contents.verseText: Ye shall purchase food of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.
contents: Ye shall purchase food of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also buy water of them for money, that ye may
drink.

contents.verseText: For Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee in all the work of thy hand; he hath known thy walking through this great wilderness: these forty years Jehovah thy God hath been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing.
contents: For Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee in all the work of thy hand; he hath known thy walking through this great
wilderness: these forty years Jehovah thy God hath been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing.

contents.verseText: So we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau, that dwell in Seir, from the way of the Arabah from Elath and from Ezion-geber. And we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
contents: So we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau, that dwell in Seir, from the way of the Arabah from Elath and from
Ezion-geber.
And we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Vex not Moab, neither contend with them in battle; for I will not give thee of his land for a possession; because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot for a possession.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Vex not Moab, neither contend with them in battle; for I will not give thee of his land for a
possession; because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot for a possession.

contents.verseText: (The Emim dwelt therein aforetime, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakim:
contents: (The Emim dwelt therein aforetime, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakim:

contents.verseText: these also are accounted Rephaim, as the Anakim; but the Moabites call them Emim.
contents: these also are accounted Rephaim, as the Anakim; but the Moabites call them Emim.

contents.verseText: The Horites also dwelt in Seir aforetime, but the children of Esau succeeded them; and they destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which Jehovah gave unto them.)
contents: The Horites also dwelt in Seir aforetime, but the children of Esau succeeded them; and they destroyed them from before
them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which Jehovah gave unto them.)

contents.verseText: Now rise up, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.
contents: Now rise up, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.

contents.verseText: And the days in which we came from Kadesh-barnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, were thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the midst of the camp, as Jehovah sware unto them.
contents: And the days in which we came from Kadesh-barnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, were thirty and eight years;
until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the midst of the camp, as Jehovah sware unto them.

contents.verseText: Moreover the hand of Jehovah was against them, to destroy them from the midst of the camp, until they were consumed.
contents: Moreover the hand of Jehovah was against them, to destroy them from the midst of the camp, until they were consumed.

contents.verseText: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
contents: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,

contents.verseText: that Jehovah spake unto me, saying,
contents: that Jehovah spake unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Thou art this day to pass over Ar, the border of Moab:
contents: Thou art this day to pass over Ar, the border of Moab:

contents.verseText: and when thou comest nigh over against the children of Ammon, vex them not, nor contend with them; for I will not give thee of the land of the children of Ammon for a possession; because I have given it unto the children of Lot for a possession.
contents: and when thou comest nigh over against the children of Ammon, vex them not, nor contend with them; for I will not give
thee of the land of the children of Ammon for a possession; because I have given it unto the children of Lot for a possession.

contents.verseText: (That also is accounted a land of Rephaim: Rephaim dwelt therein aforetime; but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,
contents: (That also is accounted a land of Rephaim: Rephaim dwelt therein aforetime; but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,

contents.verseText: a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakim; but Jehovah destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead;
contents: a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakim; but Jehovah destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and
dwelt in their stead;

contents.verseText: as he did for the children of Esau, that dwell in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day.
contents: as he did for the children of Esau, that dwell in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them; and they
succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day.

contents.verseText: And the Avvim, that dwelt in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, that came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.)
contents: And the Avvim, that dwelt in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, that came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and
dwelt in their stead.)

contents.verseText: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the valley of the Arnon: behold, I have given into thy hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land; begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.
contents: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the valley of the Arnon: behold, I have given into thy hand Sihon the
Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land; begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.

contents.verseText: This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the peoples that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.
contents: This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the peoples that are under the whole heaven, who
shall hear the report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.

contents.verseText: And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
contents: And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,

contents.verseText: Let me pass through thy land: I will go along by the highway, I will turn neither unto the right hand nor to the left.
contents: Let me pass through thy land: I will go along by the highway, I will turn neither unto the right hand nor to the left.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt sell me food for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only let me pass through on my feet;
contents: Thou shalt sell me food for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only let me pass
through on my feet;

contents.verseText: as the children of Esau that dwell in Seir, and the Moabites that dwell in Ar, did unto me; until I shall pass over the Jordan into the land which Jehovah our God giveth us.
contents: as the children of Esau that dwell in Seir, and the Moabites that dwell in Ar, did unto me; until I shall pass over the
Jordan into the land which Jehovah our God giveth us.

contents.verseText: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him; for Jehovah thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as at this day.
contents: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him; for Jehovah thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart
obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as at this day.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his land.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou
mayest inherit his land.

contents.verseText: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, unto battle at Jahaz.
contents: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, unto battle at Jahaz.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah our God delivered him up before us; and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people.
contents: And Jehovah our God delivered him up before us; and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people.

contents.verseText: And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones; we left none remaining:
contents: And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones;
we left none remaining:

contents.verseText: only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we had taken.
contents: only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we had taken.

contents.verseText: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and from the city that is in the valley, even unto Gilead, there was not a city too high for us; Jehovah our God delivered up all before us:
contents: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and
the city that is in the valley, even unto Gilead, there was not a city too high for us; Jehovah our God delivered up all before us:

contents.verseText: only to the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not near; all the side of the river Jabbok, and the cities of the hill-country, and wheresoever Jehovah our God forbade us.
contents: only to the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not near; all the side of the river Jabbok, and the cities of the
hill-country, and wheresoever Jehovah our God forbade us.

contents.verseText: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, unto battle at Edrei.
contents: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, unto
battle at Edrei.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Fear him not; for I have delivered him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Fear him not; for I have delivered him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and
thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.

contents.verseText: So Jehovah our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
contents: So Jehovah our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none
was left to him remaining.

contents.verseText: And we took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we took not from them; threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
contents: And we took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we took not from them; threescore cities, all the
region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

contents.verseText: All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars; besides the unwalled towns a great many.
contents: All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars; besides the unwalled towns a great many.

contents.verseText: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones.
contents: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every inhabited city, with the
women and the little ones.

contents.verseText: But all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey unto ourselves.
contents: But all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey unto ourselves.

contents.verseText: And we took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites that were beyond the Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon unto mount Hermon
contents: And we took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites that were beyond the Jordan, from the
valley of the Arnon unto mount Hermon

contents.verseText: (which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir);
contents: Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir);

contents.verseText: all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
contents: all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in
Bashan.

contents.verseText: (For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Rephaim; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.)
contents: (For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Rephaim; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it
not in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit
of a man.)

contents.verseText: And this land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill-country of Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites:
contents: And this land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the
hill-country of Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites:

contents.verseText: and the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half-tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, even all Bashan. (The same is called the land of Rephaim.
contents: and the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half-tribe of Manasseh; all the region of
Argob, even all Bashan. (The same is called the land of Rephaim.

contents.verseText: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, unto the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and called them, even Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth-jair, unto this day.)
contents: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, unto the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and called
them, even Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth-jair, unto this day.)

contents.verseText: And I gave Gilead unto Machir.
contents: And I gave Gilead unto Machir.

contents.verseText: And unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the valley, and the border thereof, even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon;
contents: And unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the
valley, and the border
, even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon;

contents.verseText: the Arabah also, and the Jordan and the border thereof, from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.
contents: the Arabah also, and the Jordan and the border
, from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the Arabah, the
Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.

contents.verseText: And I commanded you at that time, saying, Jehovah your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all the men of valor.
contents: And I commanded you at that time, saying, Jehovah your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over
armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all the men of valor.

contents.verseText: But your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle (I know that ye have much cattle), shall abide in your cities which I have given you,
contents: But your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle (I know that ye have much cattle), shall abide in your cities which
I have given you,

contents.verseText: until Jehovah give rest unto your brethren, as unto you, and they also possess the land which Jehovah your God giveth them beyond the Jordan: then shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.
contents: until Jehovah give rest unto your brethren, as unto you, and they also possess the land which Jehovah your God giveth
them beyond the Jordan: then shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.

contents.verseText: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that Jehovah your God hath done unto these two kings: so shall Jehovah do unto all the kingdoms whither thou goest over.
contents: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that Jehovah your God hath done unto these two
kings: so shall Jehovah do unto all the kingdoms whither thou goest over.

contents.verseText: Ye shall not fear them; for Jehovah your God, he it is that fighteth for you.
contents: Ye shall not fear them; for Jehovah your God, he it is that fighteth for you.

contents.verseText: And I besought Jehovah at that time, saying,
contents: And I besought Jehovah at that time, saying,

contents.verseText: O Lord Jehovah, thou hast begun to show thy servant thy greatness, and thy strong hand: for what god is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy mighty acts?
contents: O Lord Jehovah, thou hast begun to show thy servant thy greatness, and thy strong hand: for what god is there in heaven
or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy mighty acts?

contents.verseText: Let me go over, I pray thee, and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.
contents: Let me go over, I pray thee, and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah was wroth with me for your sakes, and hearkened not unto me; and Jehovah said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.
contents: But Jehovah was wroth with me for your sakes, and hearkened not unto me; and Jehovah said unto me, Let it suffice thee;
speak no more unto me of this matter.

contents.verseText: Get thee up unto the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
contents: Get thee up unto the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and
behold with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.

contents.verseText: But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him; for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.
contents: But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him; for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause
them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.

contents.verseText: So we abode in the valley over against Beth-peor.
contents: So we abode in the valley over against Beth-peor.

contents.verseText: And now, O Israel, hearken unto the statutes and unto the ordinances, which I teach you, to do them; that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, giveth you.
contents: And now, O Israel, hearken unto the statutes and unto the ordinances, which I teach you, to do them; that ye may live, and
go in and possess the land which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, giveth you.

contents.verseText: Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish from it, that ye may keep the commandments of Jehovah your God which I command you.
contents: Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish from it, that ye may keep the commandments
of Jehovah your God which I command you.

contents.verseText: Your eyes have seen what Jehovah did because of Baal-peor; for all the men that followed Baal-peor, Jehovah thy God hath destroyed them from the midst of thee.
contents: Your eyes have seen what Jehovah did because of Baal-peor; for all the men that followed Baal-peor, Jehovah thy God hath
destroyed them from the midst of thee.

contents.verseText: But ye that did cleave unto Jehovah your God are alive every one of you this day.
contents: But ye that did cleave unto Jehovah your God are alive every one of you this day.

contents.verseText: Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as Jehovah my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the midst of the land whither ye go in to possess it.
contents: Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as Jehovah my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the midst
of the land whither ye go in to possess it.

contents.verseText: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, that shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
contents: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, that shall hear
all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.

contents.verseText: For what great nation is there, that hath a god so nigh unto them, as Jehovah our God is whensoever we call upon him?
contents: For what great nation is there, that hath a god so nigh unto them, as Jehovah our God is whensoever we call upon him?

contents.verseText: And what great nation is there, that hath statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?
contents: And what great nation is there, that hath statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law, which I set before you
this day?

contents.verseText: Only take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes saw, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life; but make them known unto thy children and thy children’s children;
contents: Only take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes saw, and lest they
depart from thy heart all the days of thy life; but make them known unto thy children and thy children’s children;

contents.verseText: the day that thou stoodest before Jehovah thy God in Horeb, when Jehovah said unto me, Assemble me the people, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children.
contents: the day that thou stoodest before Jehovah thy God in Horeb, when Jehovah said unto me, Assemble me the people, and I will
make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live upon the earth, and that they may teach
their children.

contents.verseText: And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the heart of heaven, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness.
contents: And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the heart of heaven, with darkness,
cloud, and thick darkness.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of words, but ye saw no form; only ye heard a voice.
contents: And Jehovah spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of words, but ye saw no form; only
a voice.

contents.verseText: And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
contents: And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments; and he wrote them
upon two tables of stone.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it.
contents: And Jehovah commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that ye might do them in the land whither ye
go over to possess it.

contents.verseText: Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of form on the day that Jehovah spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire;
contents: Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of form on the day that Jehovah spake unto you in Horeb
out of the midst of the fire;

contents.verseText: lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
contents: lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,

contents.verseText: the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flieth in the heavens,
contents: the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flieth in the heavens,

contents.verseText: the likeness of anything that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;
contents: the likeness of anything that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;

contents.verseText: and lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the host of heaven, thou be drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which Jehovah thy God hath allotted unto all the peoples under the whole heaven.
contents: and lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the host
of heaven, thou be drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which Jehovah thy God hath allotted unto all the peoples under
the whole heaven.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of inheritance, as at this day.
contents: But Jehovah hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of
inheritance, as at this day.

contents.verseText: Furthermore Jehovah was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in unto that good land, which Jehovah thy God giveth thee for an inheritance:
contents: Furthermore Jehovah was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should
not go in unto that good land, which Jehovah thy God giveth thee for an inheritance:

contents.verseText: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.
contents: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.

contents.verseText: Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of Jehovah your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image in the form of anything which Jehovah thy God hath forbidden thee.
contents: Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of Jehovah your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven
image in the form of anything which Jehovah thy God hath forbidden thee.

contents.verseText: For Jehovah thy God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.
contents: For Jehovah thy God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.

contents.verseText: When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children, and ye shall have been long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make a graven image in the form of anything, and shall do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah thy God, to provoke him to anger;
contents: When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children, and ye shall have been long in the land, and shall corrupt
yourselves, and make a graven image in the form of anything, and shall do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah thy God,
to provoke him to anger;

contents.verseText: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over the Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
contents: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye
go over the Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will scatter you among the peoples, and ye shall be left few in number among the nations, whither Jehovah shall lead you away.
contents: And Jehovah will scatter you among the peoples, and ye shall be left few in number among the nations, whither Jehovah
shall lead you away.

contents.verseText: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
contents: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

contents.verseText: But from thence ye shall seek Jehovah thy God, and thou shalt find him, when thou searchest after him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
contents: But from thence ye shall seek Jehovah thy God, and thou shalt find him, when thou searchest after him with all thy heart
and with all thy soul.

contents.verseText: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, in the latter days thou shalt return to Jehovah thy God, and hearken unto his voice:
contents: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, in the latter days thou shalt return to Jehovah
thy God, and hearken unto his voice:

contents.verseText: for Jehovah thy God is a merciful God; he will not fail thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.
contents: for Jehovah thy God is a merciful God; he will not fail thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy
fathers which he sware unto them.

contents.verseText: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and from the one end of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?
contents: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and
from the one end of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been
as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?

contents.verseText: Did ever a people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?
contents: Did ever a people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?

contents.verseText: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that Jehovah your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
contents: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of
nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm,
and by great terrors, according to all that Jehovah your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

contents.verseText: Unto thee it was showed, that thou mightest know that Jehovah he is God; there is none else besides him.
contents: Unto thee it was showed, that thou mightest know that Jehovah he is God; there is none else besides him.

contents.verseText: Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he made thee to see his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.
contents: Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he made thee to see his great
fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.

contents.verseText: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt;
contents: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out with his presence, with
his great power, out of Egypt;

contents.verseText: to drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as at this day.
contents: to drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an
inheritance, as at this day.

contents.verseText: Know therefore this day, and lay it to thy heart, that Jehovah he is God in heaven above and upon the earth beneath; there is none else.
contents: Know therefore this day, and lay it to thy heart, that Jehovah he is God in heaven above and upon the earth beneath;
there is none else.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt keep his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days in the land, which Jehovah thy God giveth thee, for ever.
contents: And thou shalt keep his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and
with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days in the land, which Jehovah thy God giveth thee, for ever.

contents.verseText: Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrising;
contents: Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrising;

contents.verseText: that the manslayer might flee thither, that slayeth his neighbor unawares, and hated him not in time past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
contents: that the manslayer might flee thither, that slayeth his neighbor unawares, and hated him not in time past; and that
fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:

contents.verseText: namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
contents: , Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the
Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.

contents.verseText: And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:
contents: And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:

contents.verseText: these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, when they came forth out of Egypt,
contents: these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, when they
came forth out of Egypt,

contents.verseText: beyond the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, when they came forth out of Egypt.
contents: beyond the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon,
whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, when they came forth out of Egypt.

contents.verseText: And they took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrising;
contents: And they took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond
the Jordan toward the sunrising;

contents.verseText: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even unto mount Sion (the same is Hermon),
contents: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even unto mount Sion (the same is Hermon),

contents.verseText: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
contents: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.

contents.verseText: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears this day, that ye may learn them, and observe to do them.
contents: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in
your ears this day, that ye may learn them, and observe to do them.

contents.verseText: Jehovah our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
contents: Jehovah our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.

contents.verseText: Jehovah made not this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day.
contents: Jehovah made not this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day.

contents.verseText: Jehovah spake with you face to face in the mount out of the midst of the fire
contents: Jehovah spake with you face to face in the mount out of the midst of the fire

contents.verseText: (I stood between Jehovah and you at that time, to show you the word of Jehovah: for ye were afraid because of the fire, and went not up into the mount), saying,
contents: (I stood between Jehovah and you at that time, to show you the word of Jehovah: for ye were afraid because of the fire,
and went not up into the mount), saying,

contents.verseText: I am Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
contents: I am Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
contents: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt not make unto thee a graven image, nor any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
contents: Thou shalt not make unto thee a graven image,
any likeness
that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:

contents.verseText: thou shalt not bow down thyself unto them, nor serve them; for I, Jehovah, thy God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the third and upon the fourth generation of them that hate me;
contents: thou shalt not bow down thyself unto them, nor serve them; for I, Jehovah, thy God, am a jealous God, visiting the
iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the third and upon the fourth generation of them that hate me;

contents.verseText: and showing lovingkindness unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.
contents: and showing lovingkindness unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain: for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
contents: Thou shalt not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain: for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in
vain.

contents.verseText: Observe the sabbath day, to keep it holy, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee.
contents: Observe the sabbath day, to keep it holy, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee.

contents.verseText: Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work;
contents: Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work;

contents.verseText: but the seventh day is a sabbath unto Jehovah thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, nor thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass, nor any of thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates; that thy man-servant and thy maid-servant may rest as well as thou.
contents: but the seventh day is a sabbath unto Jehovah thy God:

thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, nor thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass, nor any of thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates; that thy man-servant and thy maid-servant may rest as well as thou.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and Jehovah thy God brought thee out thence by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Jehovah thy God commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.
contents: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and Jehovah thy God brought thee out thence by a
mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Jehovah thy God commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.

contents.verseText: Honor thy father and thy mother, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee; that thy days may be long, and that it may go well with thee, in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.
contents: Honor thy father and thy mother, as Jehovah thy God commanded thee; that thy days may be long, and that it may go well
with thee, in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt not kill.
contents: Thou shalt not kill.

contents.verseText: Neither shalt thou commit adultery.
contents: Neither shalt thou commit adultery.

contents.verseText: Neither shalt thou steal.
contents: Neither shalt thou steal.

contents.verseText: Neither shalt thou bear false witness against thy neighbor.
contents: Neither shalt thou bear false witness against thy neighbor.

contents.verseText: Neither shalt thou covet thy neighbor’s wife; neither shalt thou desire thy neighbor’s house, his field, or his man-servant, or his maid-servant, his ox, or his ass, or anything that is thy neighbor’s.
contents: Neither shalt thou covet thy neighbor’s wife; neither shalt thou desire thy neighbor’s house, his field, or his
man-servant, or his maid-servant, his ox, or his ass, or anything that is thy neighbor’s.

contents.verseText: These words Jehovah spake unto all your assembly in the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. And he wrote them upon two tables of stone, and gave them unto me.
contents: These words Jehovah spake unto all your assembly in the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the
thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. And he wrote them upon two tables of stone, and gave them unto me.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass, when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that ye came near unto me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;
contents: And it came to pass, when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire,
that ye came near unto me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;

contents.verseText: and ye said, Behold, Jehovah our God hath showed us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God doth speak with man, and he liveth.
contents: and ye said, Behold, Jehovah our God hath showed us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the
midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God doth speak with man, and he liveth.

contents.verseText: Now therefore why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of Jehovah our God any more, then we shall die.
contents: Now therefore why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of Jehovah our God any more,
then we shall die.

contents.verseText: For who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
contents: For who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we
have, and lived?

contents.verseText: Go thou near, and hear all that Jehovah our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that Jehovah our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
contents: Go thou near, and hear all that Jehovah our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that Jehovah our God shall speak
unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me; and Jehovah said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have spoken.
contents: And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me; and Jehovah said unto me, I have heard the voice of the
words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have spoken.

contents.verseText: Oh that there were such a heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them, and with their children for ever!
contents: Oh that there were such a heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my commandments always, that it might be
well with them, and with their children for ever!

contents.verseText: Go say to them, Return ye to your tents.
contents: Go say to them, Return ye to your tents.

contents.verseText: But as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto thee all the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.
contents: But as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto thee all the commandment, and the statutes, and the
ordinances, which thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.

contents.verseText: Ye shall observe to do therefore as Jehovah your God hath commanded you: ye shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
contents: Ye shall observe to do therefore as Jehovah your God hath commanded you: ye shall not turn aside to the right hand or to
the left.

contents.verseText: Ye shall walk in all the way which Jehovah your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.
contents: Ye shall walk in all the way which Jehovah your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with
you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.

contents.verseText: Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Jehovah your God commanded to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it;
contents: Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Jehovah your God commanded to teach you, that ye
might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it;

contents.verseText: that thou mightest fear Jehovah thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged.
contents: that thou mightest fear Jehovah thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou, and
thy son, and thy son’s son, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged.

contents.verseText: Hear therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily, as Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, hath promised unto thee, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
contents: Hear therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily, as
Jehovah, the God of thy fathers, hath promised unto thee, in a land flowing with milk and honey.

contents.verseText: Hear, O Israel: Jehovah our God is one Jehovah:
contents: Hear, O Israel: Jehovah our God is one Jehovah:

contents.verseText: and thou shalt love Jehovah thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
contents: and thou shalt love Jehovah thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.

contents.verseText: And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be upon thy heart;
contents: And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be upon thy heart;

contents.verseText: and thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thy house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
contents: and thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thy house, and when

contents.verseText: And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thy hand, and they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes.
contents: And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thy hand, and they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt write them upon the door-posts of thy house, and upon thy gates.
contents: And thou shalt write them upon the door-posts of thy house, and upon thy gates.

contents.verseText: And it shall be, when Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land which he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give thee, great and goodly cities, which thou buildest not,
contents: And it shall be, when Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land which he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to

contents.verseText: and houses full of all good things, which thou filledst not, and cisterns hewn out, which thou hewedst not, vineyards and olive-trees, which thou plantedst not, and thou shalt eat and be full;
contents: and houses full of all good things, which thou filledst not, and cisterns hewn out, which thou hewedst not, vineyards and

contents.verseText: then beware lest thou forget Jehovah, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
contents: then beware lest thou forget Jehovah, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt fear Jehovah thy God; and him shalt thou serve, and shalt swear by his name.
contents: Thou shalt fear Jehovah thy God; and him shalt thou serve, and shalt swear by his name.

contents.verseText: Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples that are round about you;
contents: Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples that are round about you;

contents.verseText: for Jehovah thy God in the midst of thee is a jealous God; lest the anger of Jehovah thy God be kindled against thee, and he destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
contents: for Jehovah thy God in the midst of thee is a jealous God; lest the anger of Jehovah thy God be kindled against thee, and

contents.verseText: Ye shall not tempt Jehovah your God, as ye tempted him in Massah.
contents: Ye shall not tempt Jehovah your God, as ye tempted him in Massah.

contents.verseText: Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of Jehovah your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he hath commanded thee.
contents: Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of Jehovah your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he hath

contents.verseText: And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of Jehovah; that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in and possess the good land which Jehovah sware unto thy fathers,
contents: And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of Jehovah; that it may be well with thee, and that thou

contents.verseText: to thrust out all thine enemies from before thee, as Jehovah hath spoken.
contents: to thrust out all thine enemies from before thee, as Jehovah hath spoken.

contents.verseText: When thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Jehovah our God hath commanded you?
contents: When thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which

contents.verseText: then thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh’s bondmen in Egypt: and Jehovah brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;
contents: then thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh’s bondmen in Egypt: and Jehovah brought us out of Egypt with a mighty

contents.verseText: and Jehovah showed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his house, before our eyes;
contents: and Jehovah showed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his house, before our eyes;

contents.verseText: and he brought us out from thence, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.
contents: and he brought us out from thence, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear Jehovah our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as at this day.
contents: And Jehovah commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear Jehovah our God, for our good always, that he might preserve

contents.verseText: And it shall be righteousness unto us, if we observe to do all this commandment before Jehovah our God, as he hath commanded us.
contents: And it shall be righteousness unto us, if we observe to do all this commandment before Jehovah our God, as he hath

contents.verseText: When Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land whither thou goest to possess it, and shall cast out many nations before thee, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than thou;
contents: When Jehovah thy God shall bring thee into the land whither thou goest to possess it, and shall cast out many nations
before thee, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the
Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than thou;

contents.verseText: and when Jehovah thy God shall deliver them up before thee, and thou shalt smite them; then thou shalt utterly destroy them: thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor show mercy unto them;
contents: and when Jehovah thy God shall deliver them up before thee, and thou shalt smite them; then thou shalt utterly destroy

contents.verseText: neither shalt thou make marriages with them; thy daughter thou shalt not give unto his son, nor his daughter shalt thou take unto thy son.
contents: neither shalt thou make marriages with them; thy daughter thou shalt not give unto his son, nor his daughter shalt thou

contents.verseText: For he will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of Jehovah be kindled against you, and he will destroy thee quickly.
contents: For he will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of Jehovah be kindled
against you, and he will destroy thee quickly.

contents.verseText: But thus shall ye deal with them: ye shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and hew down their Asherim, and burn their graven images with fire.
contents: But thus shall ye deal with them: ye shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and hew down their
Asherim, and burn their graven images with fire.

contents.verseText: For thou art a holy people unto Jehovah thy God: Jehovah thy God hath chosen thee to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples that are upon the face of the earth.
contents: For thou art a holy people unto Jehovah thy God: Jehovah thy God hath chosen thee to be a people for his own possession,
above all peoples that are upon the face of the earth.

contents.verseText: Jehovah did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people; for ye were the fewest of all peoples:
contents: Jehovah did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people; for ye were the
fewest of all peoples:

contents.verseText: but because Jehovah loveth you, and because he would keep the oath which he sware unto your fathers, hath Jehovah brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
contents: but because Jehovah loveth you, and because he would keep the oath which he sware unto your fathers, hath Jehovah brought
you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.

contents.verseText: Know therefore that Jehovah thy God, he is God, the faithful God, who keepeth covenant and lovingkindness with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations,
contents: Know therefore that Jehovah thy God, he is God, the faithful God, who keepeth covenant and lovingkindness with them that
love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations,

contents.verseText: and repayeth them that hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him that hateth him, he will repay him to his face.
contents: and repayeth them that hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him that hateth him, he will
repay him to his face.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command thee this day, to do them.
contents: Thou shalt therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command thee this day, to do
them.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, because ye hearken to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that Jehovah thy God will keep with thee the covenant and the lovingkindness which he sware unto thy fathers:
contents: And it shall come to pass, because ye hearken to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that Jehovah thy God will keep
with thee the covenant and the lovingkindness which he sware unto thy fathers:

contents.verseText: and he will love thee, and bless thee, and multiply thee; he will also bless the fruit of thy body and the fruit of thy ground, thy grain and thy new wine and thine oil, the increase of thy cattle and the young of thy flock, in the land which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee.
contents: and he will love thee, and bless thee, and multiply thee; he will also bless the fruit of thy body and the fruit of thy
ground, thy grain and thy new wine and thine oil, the increase of thy cattle and the young of thy flock, in the land which he
sware unto thy fathers to give thee.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt be blessed above all peoples: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your cattle.
contents: Thou shalt be blessed above all peoples: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your cattle.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will take away from thee all sickness; and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which thou knowest, will he put upon thee, but will lay them upon all them that hate thee.
contents: And Jehovah will take away from thee all sickness; and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which thou knowest, will he
put upon thee, but will lay them upon all them that hate thee.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt consume all the peoples that Jehovah thy God shall deliver unto thee; thine eye shall not pity them: neither shalt thou serve their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee.
contents: And thou shalt consume all the peoples that Jehovah thy God shall deliver unto thee; thine eye shall not pity them:
neither shalt thou serve their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee.

contents.verseText: If thou shalt say in thy heart, These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?
contents: If thou shalt say in thy heart, These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?

contents.verseText: thou shalt not be afraid of them: thou shalt well remember what Jehovah thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt;
contents: thou shalt not be afraid of them: thou shalt well remember what Jehovah thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt;

contents.verseText: the great trials which thine eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, whereby Jehovah thy God brought thee out: so shall Jehovah thy God do unto all the peoples of whom thou art afraid.
contents: the great trials which thine eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm,
whereby Jehovah thy God brought thee out: so shall Jehovah thy God do unto all the peoples of whom thou art afraid.

contents.verseText: Moreover Jehovah thy God will send the hornet among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves, perish from before thee.
contents: Moreover Jehovah thy God will send the hornet among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves, perish from
before thee.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt not be affrighted at them; for Jehovah thy God is in the midst of thee, a great God and a terrible.
contents: Thou shalt not be affrighted at them; for Jehovah thy God is in the midst of thee, a great God and a terrible.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah thy God will cast out those nations before thee by little and little: thou mayest not consume them at once, lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.
contents: And Jehovah thy God will cast out those nations before thee by little and little: thou mayest not consume them at once,
lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah thy God will deliver them up before thee, and will discomfit them with a great discomfiture, until they be destroyed.
contents: But Jehovah thy God will deliver them up before thee, and will discomfit them with a great discomfiture, until they be
destroyed.

contents.verseText: And he will deliver their kings into thy hand, and thou shalt make their name to perish from under heaven: there shall no man be able to stand before thee, until thou have destroyed them.
contents: And he will deliver their kings into thy hand, and thou shalt make their name to perish from under heaven: there shall no
man be able to stand before thee, until thou have destroyed them.

contents.verseText: The graven images of their gods shall ye burn with fire: thou shalt not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therein; for it is an abomination to Jehovah thy God.
contents: The graven images of their gods shall ye burn with fire: thou shalt not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor
take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therein; for it is an abomination to Jehovah thy God.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt not bring an abomination into thy house, and become a devoted thing like unto it: thou shalt utterly detest it, and thou shalt utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.
contents: And thou shalt not bring an abomination into thy house, and become a devoted thing like unto it: thou shalt utterly
detest it, and thou shalt utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.

contents.verseText: All the commandment which I command thee this day shall ye observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which Jehovah sware unto your fathers.
contents: All the commandment which I command thee this day shall ye observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and
