contents: Cursed be he that wresteth the justice
to the sojourner, fatherless, and widow. And all the people shall
say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that lieth with his father’s wife, because he hath uncovered his father’s skirt. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that lieth with his father’s wife, because he hath uncovered his father’s skirt. And all the people shall
say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that lieth with any manner of beast. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that lieth with any manner of beast. And all the people shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that lieth with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that lieth with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother. And all the people
shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that lieth with his mother-in-law. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that lieth with his mother-in-law. And all the people shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that smiteth his neighbor in secret. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that smiteth his neighbor in secret. And all the people shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that taketh a bribe to slay an innocent person. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that taketh a bribe to slay an innocent person. And all the people shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that confirmeth not the words of this law to do them. And all the people shall say, Amen.
contents: Cursed be he that confirmeth not the words of this law to do them. And all the people shall say, Amen.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his commandments which I command thee this day, that Jehovah thy God will set thee on high above all the nations of the earth:
contents: And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his
commandments which I command thee this day, that Jehovah thy God will set thee on high above all the nations of the earth:

contents.verseText: and all these blessings shall come upon thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God.
contents: and all these blessings shall come upon thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God.

contents.verseText: Blessed shalt thou be in the city, and blessed shalt thou be in the field.
contents: Blessed shalt thou be in the city, and blessed shalt thou be in the field.

contents.verseText: Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy beasts, the increase of thy cattle, and the young of thy flock.
contents: Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy beasts, the increase of thy
cattle, and the young of thy flock.

contents.verseText: Blessed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
contents: Blessed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.

contents.verseText: Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and blessed shalt thou be when thou goest out.
contents: Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and blessed shalt thou be when thou goest out.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thee: they shall come out against thee one way, and shall flee before thee seven ways.
contents: Jehovah will cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thee: they shall come out against thee one
way, and shall flee before thee seven ways.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will command the blessing upon thee in thy barns, and in all that thou puttest thy hand unto; and he will bless thee in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.
contents: Jehovah will command the blessing upon thee in thy barns, and in all that thou puttest thy hand unto; and he will bless
thee in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will establish thee for a holy people unto himself, as he hath sworn unto thee; if thou shalt keep the commandments of Jehovah thy God, and walk in his ways.
contents: Jehovah will establish thee for a holy people unto himself, as he hath sworn unto thee; if thou shalt keep the
commandments of Jehovah thy God, and walk in his ways.

contents.verseText: And all the peoples of the earth shall see that thou art called by the name of Jehovah; and they shall be afraid of thee.
contents: And all the peoples of the earth shall see that thou art called by the name of Jehovah; and they shall be afraid of thee.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will make thee plenteous for good, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, in the land which Jehovah sware unto thy fathers to give thee.
contents: And Jehovah will make thee plenteous for good, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit
of thy ground, in the land which Jehovah sware unto thy fathers to give thee.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will open unto thee his good treasure the heavens, to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless all the work of thy hand: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, and thou shalt not borrow.
contents: Jehovah will open unto thee his good treasure the heavens, to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless all
the work of thy hand: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, and thou shalt not borrow.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will make thee the head, and not the tail; and thou shalt be above only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if thou shalt hearken unto the commandments of Jehovah thy God, which I command thee this day, to observe and to do them,
contents: And Jehovah will make thee the head, and not the tail; and thou shalt be above only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if
thou shalt hearken unto the commandments of Jehovah thy God, which I command thee this day, to observe and to do

contents.verseText: and shalt not turn aside from any of the words which I command you this day, to the right hand, or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
contents: and shalt not turn aside from any of the words which I command you this day, to the right hand, or to the left, to go
after other gods to serve them.

contents.verseText: But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day, that all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee.
contents: But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all his
commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day, that all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee.

contents.verseText: Cursed shalt thou be in the city, and cursed shalt thou be in the field.
contents: Cursed shalt thou be in the city, and cursed shalt thou be in the field.

contents.verseText: Cursed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
contents: Cursed shall be thy basket and thy kneading-trough.

contents.verseText: Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, the increase of thy cattle, and the young of thy flock.
contents: Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, the increase of thy cattle, and the young of thy
flock.

contents.verseText: Cursed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and cursed shalt thou be when thou goest out.
contents: Cursed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and cursed shalt thou be when thou goest out.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will send upon thee cursing, discomfiture, and rebuke, in all that thou puttest thy hand unto to do, until thou be destroyed, and until thou perish quickly; because of the evil of thy doings, whereby thou hast forsaken me.
contents: Jehovah will send upon thee cursing, discomfiture, and rebuke, in all that thou puttest thy hand unto to do, until thou
be destroyed, and until thou perish quickly; because of the evil of thy doings, whereby thou hast forsaken me.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will make the pestilence cleave unto thee, until he have consumed thee from off the land, whither thou goest in to possess it.
contents: Jehovah will make the pestilence cleave unto thee, until he have consumed thee from off the land, whither thou goest in
to possess it.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will smite thee with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with fiery heat, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
contents: Jehovah will smite thee with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with fiery heat, and with the sword,
and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.

contents.verseText: And thy heaven that is over thy head shall be brass, and the earth that is under thee shall be iron.
contents: And thy heaven that is over thy head shall be brass, and the earth that is under thee shall be iron.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will make the rain of thy land powder and dust: from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
contents: Jehovah will make the rain of thy land powder and dust: from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be
destroyed.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will cause thee to be smitten before thine enemies; thou shalt go out one way against them, and shalt flee seven ways before them: and thou shalt be tossed to and from among all the kingdoms of the earth.
contents: Jehovah will cause thee to be smitten before thine enemies; thou shalt go out one way against them, and shalt flee seven
ways before them: and thou shalt be tossed to and from among all the kingdoms of the earth.

contents.verseText: And thy dead body shall be food unto all birds of the heavens, and unto the beasts of the earth; and there shall be none to frighten them away.
contents: And thy dead body shall be food unto all birds of the heavens, and unto the beasts of the earth; and there shall be none
to frighten them away.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will smite thee with the boil of Egypt, and with the emerods, and with the scurvy, and with the itch, whereof thou canst not be healed.
contents: Jehovah will smite thee with the boil of Egypt, and with the emerods, and with the scurvy, and with the itch, whereof
thou canst not be healed.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with astonishment of heart;
contents: Jehovah will smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with astonishment of heart;

contents.verseText: and thou shalt grope at noonday, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thy ways: and thou shalt be only oppressed and robbed alway, and there shall be none to save thee.
contents: and thou shalt grope at noonday, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thy ways: and thou shalt
be only oppressed and robbed alway, and there shall be none to save thee.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: thou shalt build a house, and thou shalt not dwell therein: thou shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not use the fruit thereof.
contents: Thou shalt betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: thou shalt build a house, and thou shalt not dwell
therein: thou shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not use the fruit thereof.

contents.verseText: Thine ox shall be slain before thine eyes, and thou shalt not eat thereof: thine ass shall be violently taken away from before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep shall be given unto thine enemies, and thou shalt have none to save thee.
contents: Thine ox shall be slain before thine eyes, and thou shalt not eat thereof: thine ass shall be violently taken away from
before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep shall be given unto thine enemies, and thou shalt have none to
save thee.

contents.verseText: Thy sons and thy daughters shall be given unto another people; and thine eyes shall look, and fail with longing for them all the day: and there shall be nought in the power of thy hand.
contents: Thy sons and thy daughters shall be given unto another people; and thine eyes shall look, and fail with longing for them
all the day: and there shall be nought in the power of thy hand.

contents.verseText: The fruit of thy ground, and all thy labors, shall a nation which thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed alway;
contents: The fruit of thy ground, and all thy labors, shall a nation which thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be only
oppressed and crushed alway;

contents.verseText: so that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.
contents: so that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will smite thee in the knees, and in the legs, with a sore boil, whereof thou canst not be healed, from the sole of thy foot unto the crown of thy head.
contents: Jehovah will smite thee in the knees, and in the legs, with a sore boil, whereof thou canst not be healed, from the sole
of thy foot unto the crown of thy head.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will bring thee, and thy king whom thou shalt set over thee, unto a nation that thou hast not known, thou nor thy fathers; and there shalt thou serve other gods, wood and stone.
contents: Jehovah will bring thee, and thy king whom thou shalt set over thee, unto a nation that thou hast not known, thou nor thy
fathers; and there shalt thou serve other gods, wood and stone.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword, among all the peoples whither Jehovah shall lead thee away.
contents: And thou shalt become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword, among all the peoples whither Jehovah shall lead thee
away.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt carry much seed out into the field, and shalt gather little in; for the locust shall consume it.
contents: Thou shalt carry much seed out into the field, and shalt gather little in; for the locust shall consume it.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt plant vineyards and dress them, but thou shalt neither drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes; for the worm shall eat them.
contents: Thou shalt plant vineyards and dress them, but thou shalt neither drink of the wine, nor gather
; for the worm shall eat them.

contents.verseText: Thou shalt have olive-trees throughout all thy borders, but thou shalt not anoint thyself with the oil; for thine olive shall cast its fruit.
contents: Thou shalt have olive-trees throughout all thy borders, but thou shalt not anoint thyself with the oil; for thine olive
shall cast

contents.verseText: Thou shalt beget sons and daughters, but they shall not be thine; for they shall go into captivity.
contents: Thou shalt beget sons and daughters, but they shall not be thine; for they shall go into captivity.

contents.verseText: All thy trees and the fruit of thy ground shall the locust possess.
contents: All thy trees and the fruit of thy ground shall the locust possess.

contents.verseText: The sojourner that is in the midst of thee shall mount up above thee higher and higher; and thou shalt come down lower and lower.
contents: The sojourner that is in the midst of thee shall mount up above thee higher and higher; and thou shalt come down lower
and lower.

contents.verseText: He shall lend to thee, and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall be the head, and thou shalt be the tail.
contents: He shall lend to thee, and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall be the head, and thou shalt be the tail.

contents.verseText: And all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee, and overtake thee, till thou be destroyed; because thou hearkenedst not unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee:
contents: And all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee, and overtake thee, till thou be destroyed; because thou
hearkenedst not unto the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee:

contents.verseText: and they shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder, and upon thy seed for ever.
contents: and they shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder, and upon thy seed for ever.

contents.verseText: Because thou servedst not Jehovah thy God with joyfulness, and with gladness of heart, by reason of the abundance of all things;
contents: Because thou servedst not Jehovah thy God with joyfulness, and with gladness of heart, by reason of the abundance of all
things;

contents.verseText: therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies that Jehovah shall send against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he have destroyed thee.
contents: therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies that Jehovah shall send against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in
nakedness, and in want of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he have destroyed thee.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, as the eagle flieth; a nation whose tongue thou shalt not understand;
contents: Jehovah will bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, as the eagle flieth; a nation whose tongue
thou shalt not understand;

contents.verseText: a nation of fierce countenance, that shall not regard the person of the old, nor show favor to the young,
contents: a nation of fierce countenance, that shall not regard the person of the old, nor show favor to the young,

contents.verseText: and shall eat the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy ground, until thou be destroyed; that also shall not leave thee grain, new wine, or oil, the increase of thy cattle, or the young of thy flock, until they have caused thee to perish.
contents: and shall eat the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy ground, until thou be destroyed; that also shall not leave
thee grain, new wine, or oil, the increase of thy cattle, or the young of thy flock, until they have caused thee to perish.

contents.verseText: And they shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down, wherein thou trustedst, throughout all thy land; and they shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land, which Jehovah thy God hath given thee.
contents: And they shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down, wherein thou trustedst,
throughout all thy land; and they shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land, which Jehovah thy God hath given
thee.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt eat the fruit of thine own body, the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, whom Jehovah thy God hath given thee, in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemies shall distress thee.
contents: And thou shalt eat the fruit of thine own body, the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, whom Jehovah thy God hath
given thee, in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemies shall distress thee.

contents.verseText: The man that is tender among you, and very delicate, his eye shall be evil toward his brother, and toward the wife of his bosom, and toward the remnant of his children whom he hath remaining;
contents: The man that is tender among you, and very delicate, his eye shall be evil toward his brother, and toward the wife of his
bosom, and toward the remnant of his children whom he hath remaining;

contents.verseText: so that he will not give to any of them of the flesh of his children whom he shall eat, because he hath nothing left him, in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemy shall distress thee in all thy gates.
contents: so that he will not give to any of them of the flesh of his children whom he shall eat, because he hath nothing left him,
in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemy shall distress thee in all thy gates.

contents.verseText: The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom, and toward her son, and toward her daughter,
contents: The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for
delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom, and toward her son, and toward her
daughter,

contents.verseText: and toward her young one that cometh out from between her feet, and toward her children whom she shall bear; for she shall eat them for want of all things secretly, in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemy shall distress thee in thy gates.
contents: and toward her young one that cometh out from between her feet, and toward her children whom she shall bear; for she
shall eat them for want of all things secretly, in the siege and in the distress wherewith thine enemy shall distress thee in
thy gates.

contents.verseText: If thou wilt not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that thou mayest fear this glorious and fearful name, JEHOVAH THY GOD;
contents: If thou wilt not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that thou mayest fear this
glorious and fearful name, JEHOVAH THY GOD;

contents.verseText: then Jehovah will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance, and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.
contents: then Jehovah will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance,
and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.

contents.verseText: And he will bring upon thee again all the diseases of Egypt, which thou wast afraid of; and they shall cleave unto thee.
contents: And he will bring upon thee again all the diseases of Egypt, which thou wast afraid of; and they shall cleave unto thee.

contents.verseText: Also every sickness, and every plague, which is not written in the book of this law, them will Jehovah bring upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
contents: Also every sickness, and every plague, which is not written in the book of this law, them will Jehovah bring upon thee,
until thou be destroyed.

contents.verseText: And ye shall be left few in number, whereas ye were as the stars of heaven for multitude; because thou didst not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God.
contents: And ye shall be left few in number, whereas ye were as the stars of heaven for multitude; because thou didst not hearken
unto the voice of Jehovah thy God.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, that, as Jehovah rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you, so Jehovah will rejoice over you to cause you to perish, and to destroy you; and ye shall be plucked from off the land whither thou goest in to possess it.
contents: And it shall come to pass, that, as Jehovah rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you, so Jehovah will
rejoice over you to cause you to perish, and to destroy you; and ye shall be plucked from off the land whither thou goest in to
possess it.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will scatter thee among all peoples, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth; and there thou shalt serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou nor thy fathers, even wood and stone.
contents: And Jehovah will scatter thee among all peoples, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth; and
there thou shalt serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou nor thy fathers, even wood and stone.

contents.verseText: And among these nations shalt thou find no ease, and there shall be no rest for the sole of thy foot: but Jehovah will give thee there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and pining of soul;
contents: And among these nations shalt thou find no ease, and there shall be no rest for the sole of thy foot: but Jehovah will
give thee there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and pining of soul;

contents.verseText: and thy life shall hang in doubt before thee; and thou shalt fear night and day, and shalt have no assurance of thy life.
contents: and thy life shall hang in doubt before thee; and thou shalt fear night and day, and shalt have no assurance of thy life.

contents.verseText: In the morning thou shalt say, Would it were even! and at even thou shalt say, Would it were morning! for the fear of thy heart which thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.
contents: In the morning thou shalt say, Would it were even! and at even thou shalt say, Would it were morning! for the fear of thy
heart which thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will bring thee into Egypt again with ships, by the way whereof I said unto thee, Thou shalt see it no more again: and there ye shall sell yourselves unto your enemies for bondmen and for bondwomen, and no man shall buy you.
contents: And Jehovah will bring thee into Egypt again with ships, by the way whereof I said unto thee, Thou shalt see it no more
again: and there ye shall sell yourselves unto your enemies for bondmen and for bondwomen, and no man shall buy you.

contents.verseText: These are the words of the covenant which Jehovah commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
contents: These are the words of the covenant which Jehovah commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab,
besides the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.

contents.verseText: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Ye have seen all that Jehovah did before your eyes in the land of Egypt unto Pharaoh, and unto all his servants, and unto all his land;
contents: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Ye have seen all that Jehovah did before your eyes in the land of
Egypt unto Pharaoh, and unto all his servants, and unto all his land;

contents.verseText: the great trials which thine eyes saw, the signs, and those great wonders:
contents: the great trials which thine eyes saw, the signs, and those great wonders:

contents.verseText: but Jehovah hath not given you a heart to know, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
contents: but Jehovah hath not given you a heart to know, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.

contents.verseText: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxed old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxed old upon thy foot.
contents: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxed old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxed old
upon thy foot.

contents.verseText: Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink; that ye may know that I am Jehovah your God.
contents: Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink; that ye may know that I am Jehovah your God.

contents.verseText: And when ye came unto this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us unto battle, and we smote them:
contents: And when ye came unto this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us unto battle,
and we smote them:

contents.verseText: and we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of the Manassites.
contents: and we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of
the Manassites.

contents.verseText: Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
contents: Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.

contents.verseText: Ye stand this day all of you before Jehovah your God; your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the men of Israel,
contents: Ye stand this day all of you before Jehovah your God; your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all
the men of Israel,

contents.verseText: your little ones, your wives, and thy sojourner that is in the midst of thy camps, from the hewer of thy wood unto the drawer of thy water;
contents: your little ones, your wives, and thy sojourner that is in the midst of thy camps, from the hewer of thy wood unto the
drawer of thy water;

contents.verseText: that thou mayest enter into the covenant of Jehovah thy God, and into his oath, which Jehovah thy God maketh with thee this day;
contents: that thou mayest enter into the covenant of Jehovah thy God, and into his oath, which Jehovah thy God maketh with thee
this day;

contents.verseText: that he may establish thee this day unto himself for a people, and that he may be unto thee a God, as he spake unto thee, and as he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
contents: that he may establish thee this day unto himself for a people, and that he may be unto thee a God, as he spake unto thee,
and as he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

contents.verseText: Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath,
contents: Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath,

contents.verseText: but with him that standeth here with us this day before Jehovah our God, and also with him that is not here with us this day
contents: but with him that standeth here with us this day before Jehovah our God, and also with him that is not here with us this
day

contents.verseText: (for ye know how we dwelt in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the midst of the nations through which ye passed;
contents: (for ye know how we dwelt in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the midst of the nations through which ye passed;

contents.verseText: and ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them);
contents: and ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them);

contents.verseText: lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from Jehovah our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood;
contents: lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from Jehovah our

contents.verseText: and it come to pass, when he heareth the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry.
contents: and it come to pass, when he heareth the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have
peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry.

contents.verseText: Jehovah will not pardon him, but then the anger of Jehovah and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the curse that is written in this book shall lie upon him, and Jehovah will blot out his name from under heaven.
contents: Jehovah will not pardon him, but then the anger of Jehovah and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the
curse that is written in this book shall lie upon him, and Jehovah will blot out his name from under heaven.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah will set him apart unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that is written in this book of the law.
contents: And Jehovah will set him apart unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant
that is written in this book of the law.

contents.verseText: And the generation to come, your children that shall rise up after you, and the foreigner that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses wherewith Jehovah hath made it sick;
contents: And the generation to come, your children that shall rise up after you, and the foreigner that shall come from a far
land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses wherewith Jehovah hath made it sick;

contents.verseText: and that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and a burning, that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which Jehovah overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath:
contents: the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt,
a burning,
it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom
and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which Jehovah overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath:

contents.verseText: even all the nations shall say, Wherefore hath Jehovah done thus unto this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?

contents.verseText: Then men shall say, Because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,
contents: Then men shall say, Because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when

contents.verseText: and went and served other gods, and worshipped them, gods that they knew not, and that he had not given unto them:

contents.verseText: therefore the anger of Jehovah was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curse that is written in this book;

contents.verseText: and Jehovah rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as at this day.

contents.verseText: The secret things belong unto Jehovah our God; but the things that are revealed belong unto us and to our children for ever, that we may do all the words of this law.
contents: The secret things belong unto Jehovah our God; but the things that are revealed belong unto us and to our children for
ever, that we may do all the words of this law.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when all these things are come upon thee, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before thee, and thou shalt call them to mind among all the nations, whither Jehovah thy God hath driven thee,
contents: And it shall come to pass, when all these things are come upon thee, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before
thee, and thou shalt call them to mind among all the nations, whither Jehovah thy God hath driven thee,

contents.verseText: and shalt return unto Jehovah thy God, and shalt obey his voice according to all that I command thee this day, thou and thy children, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul;

thy children, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul;

contents.verseText: that then Jehovah thy God will turn thy captivity, and have compassion upon thee, and will return and gather thee from all the peoples, whither Jehovah thy God hath scattered thee.
contents: that then Jehovah thy God will turn thy captivity, and have compassion upon thee, and will return and gather thee from all
